citeinfo.title: Sleepers River Blank Statistics
citeinfo.othercit: This metadata file describes 1 of the 6 data tables published together (see Larger Work section).

citeinfo.title: Aqueous chemistry database, Sleepers River Research Watershed, Danville, Vermont, 1991-2018

descript.abstract: This table summarizes the analytical results for blank water, either direct checks on the deionized water produced at the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) sample preparation laboratory in Montpelier, Vermont (analytical blank = AB), or of that same water taken through a field processing step such as filtration (field blank = FB).
descript.purpose: Since clean water is important to minimize contamination during cleaning of sample bottles and other equipment, it is important to know that the water is pure, and that the field processing is not introducing contamination.

idinfo.accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
idinfo.useconst: None. Users are advised to read the dataset's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.
idinfo.datacred: U.S. Geological Survey Land Change Science

attracc.attraccr: Analytical results for blank water are presented using three metrics calculated relative to each analyte's detection limit. These metrics provide a measure of sample collection quality control for analyses reported in"1. Sleepers River Aqueous Chemistry.csv." The calculations in and of themselves are determinations of sample contamination. Any uncertainty lies in the analyses themselves and not in the calculations.

dataqual.complete: Dataset is considered complete for the information presented 08/01/1991-12/31/2018.

enttyp.enttypd: This comma delimited (CSV) table presents summary statistics of analytical blanks (AB) and field blanks (FB). NA denotes no data.

attr.attrdef: Type of blank collected- either analytical blank (AB) or field blank (FB).

edom.edomvd: Analytical blank
Field blank

attr.attrdef: The chemical constituent analyzed. The analyte names reported in this column also appear as column names in “1. Sleepers River Aqueous Chemistry.csv.”

attr.attrdef: Number of records used to compute statistics.
Percentage of results less than detection limit.
Percentage of results less than 3 times the detection limit.
Median of results greater than 3 times the detection limit.

edom.edomvd: No Data

overview.eaover: Table "6. Sleepers River Blank Statistics.csv" presents summary statistics of analytical blanks (AB) and field blanks (FB) by analyte, collected throughout the course of the project. AB refers to analyses of deionized (DI) water produced at the USGS sample preparation laboratory in Montpelier, Vermont. FB refers to analyses of DI water after use in any step or series of steps in a sample collection procedure such as filtration. Additional metrics of chemical analysis performance can be found in "3. Sleepers River Laboratory Information.csv," "4. Sleepers River Interlaboratory Comparison.csv," and "6. Sleepers River Blank Statistics.csv."

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. Any use of trade, firm, or product names is for descriptive purposes only and does not imply endorsement by the U.S. Government.
